letters.reason: The letter starts with a date 'Vancouver, Aug. 20, 60' and a salutation to 'Liebe Mutter'. The pages follow a logical sequence, discussing a bear encounter, then transitioning to climbing (Klettern), and finally mentioning friends Wilma and Edna. The second page ends mid-sentence and the third page continues it perfectly.

This letter starts with a clear date 'October 2/61' and salutation 'Liebe Mutter und Geschwister'. The content flows logically, describing a storm on the ship, fellow passengers, and then a detailed description of a farm ('Hof') belonging to the Betzel family, which continues across the last two pages.

The first page is dated 'Vancouver Oct. 24/61' and addressed to 'Liebe Ulla'. It discusses skiing and a VW bus camper conversion. The second page continues the theme of life in Vancouver, mentioning a promotion at the bank and a fire in Los Angeles. The stationery and handwriting style are consistent.

The letter begins with a date 'Nov. 3/61' and salutation 'Liebe Mutter'. It discusses returning to Vancouver, bank work, and ski patrol. The second page continues the ski patrol topic ('gebrochene Knochen'). The third page provides a fitting closing from 'Karl', who is also mentioned on the second page. The connection between the first and second pages is thematic but strong.

The letter starts by mentioning postponing a wedding until January and discusses finding a room in Vancouver. The second page continues this topic, describing the room and giving impressions of Germany from the ship journey. The third page continues these impressions and mentions joining a choir. The flow is very coherent.

The first page is dated 'Vancouver Jan 4/62', addressed to 'Ulla', and mentions wedding preparations. The second page seems to continue a discussion, mentioning 'Karl' and a trip to the Okanagan valley. The third page continues the description of a dry, snake-infested region, which fits the description of the Okanagan. The connection is thematic.

These pages all describe life and social dynamics at a bank. They mention the director, customers, and colleagues. The pages are clearly middle sections of a letter, but they share a very strong and specific thematic link, making it highly probable they belong together in this order.
This is a complete, single-page letter dated 'Vancouver, Dec. 19/60' and addressed to 'Liebe Ursel'. It contains Christmas and New Year wishes and is self-contained.
This is a complete, single-page letter dated 'May 30, 61' and addressed to 'Liebe Mutter'. It is self-contained.
This is a complete, single-page letter dated 'Oct. 17/61' from the 'R.M.S. Westerdam', addressed to 'Liebes Anni' and signed 'Deine Mutter'.
